article.title: Quasinormal modes of charged magnetic black branes & chiral magnetic transport

choices: The evolution of sound modes with increasing magnetic field.
Three lowest helicity-2 QNMs for specific values of μ, B, and γ, with varying momentum k.
The behavior of hydrodynamic modes in the presence of a chiral anomaly.
The relationship between Landau level physics and chiral magnetic wave velocity.

multiple_choice_question.text: What phenomenon is illustrated in Figure 2?
choices: Long-lived modes approaching the real frequency axis for large magnetic fields.
Two helicity-2 QNMs of a magnetic black brane with zero chemical potential, varying magnetic field and zero momentum.
Hydrodynamic modes transitioning into chiral magnetic waves.
The effect of the Chern-Simons coupling on QNM frequencies.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded from Figure 3?
choices: The helicity-1± sectors are coupled to each other at nonzero momentum.
The lowest QNMs in the helicity-1± sectors include fake QNMs that do not depend on momentum.
The imaginary part of QNM frequencies in the helicity-1± sectors diverges for large magnetic fields.
All QNMs in the helicity-1± sectors are hydrodynamic modes.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4 shows a comparison of what?
choices: Real and imaginary parts of the hydrodynamic predictions for QNMs.
A polynomial fit to the imaginary part of the dispersion relation of the lowest QNM in the helicity-1- sector compared to numerical data.
The evolution of hydrodynamic modes at strong magnetic fields.
The effect of changing the Chern-Simons coupling on QNM frequencies.
The definition of the chiral transport coefficients in the thermodynamic frame.
The Bekenstein-Hawking entropy formula in Eddington-Finkelstein coordinates.
The hydrodynamic prediction of the dispersion relation at weak magnetic field for the lowest QNM in the helicity-1 sector.
The relation between the energy density, pressure, and magnetic susceptibility coefficient in the dual field theory.
